intro: Bunchosia cestrifolia, commonly known as the silky bush or silky tree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, fuzzy leaves and showy, pink or red flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Bunchosia cestrifolia is often found in dry, disturbed areas and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
